items.title: What Causes Leg Swelling?
items.text: Leg swelling is often a sign of underlying venous insufficiency identified via ultrasound. It is better to be assessed early.

items.title: Visible Spider Veins
items.text: Visible gross veins or spider veins can be indicators of vascular valve malfunctions and are treated effectively after evaluation.

items.title: Leg Pain
items.text: Chronic leg pain is a classic symptom of varicose veins that can be treated permanently via venous ablation.
